We are proud to be a local,
family owned and operated
business, located in Downtown
Ann Arbor within walking
distance of the University of
Michigan Campus: We have
a lot of experience and are
excited to share our menu with
you:
Whats on “aMa” Bistro menu?
Everything!
That may sound broad, but if
you explore our menu, you'll
see the diversity and that we
strive to cook foods that suit
different tastes and needs:
We enjoy cooking international
dishes as much as we enjoy
preparing classic, home-style
foods: We're as adept at
preparing intricate and complex
items as we are in preparing
simple and delicious dishes: Our
menu, as you will see, really

Breakfast

TRADITIONAL MAMAS’
BREAKFAST

Two eggs cooked to your desire, your choice of
meat, served with toast and jelly, and your choice of
homemade hash browns, or sliced tomatoes, or fresh fruit

BIG BREAKFAST

Hash browns with toast, 2 Pancakes or 2 French toast

EGGS BENEDICT AND SMOKED SALMON
Served on a locally baked whole grain bread with capers, red onions,

EGGS BENEDICT WITH SPINACH
Poached eggs served on top of a locally baked whole grain bread, topped

browns, sliced tomatoes or fresh fruit

House Specialties

fresh fruit

Address: 215 S State St, Ann Arbor, MI 48104
Description: Elevated diner fare including French toast, burgers & Albanian stews in a cozy, bright space.

summary.snippet: "Food was cooked perfectly and quickly, and the server made me feel like family."
"Nice location and ambiance but slow service and poor food quality."
"Fusion of a Greek, Indian, and American diner, with lovely flavor combinations."

most_relevant.description:
I've been reflecting for the past month, trying to fight the urge to write this review, but I am all about honesty and truthful reviews.

I've always held aMa Bistro in the highest ranks, I love their menu and I used to love the customer service.

I had a not so pleasant visit about a month ago and I haven't returned since.

Service started off normally but my waitress wouldn't make eye contact with me at all. I tried to look past it and then when I received my bill, she dropped the clipboard that the receipt is attached to on the table, not even looking at me, and just walking away.

The experience just continued to get worse and I just got overall very bad vibes from the waitress.
I was respectful the whole service and I understand that everyone has those days when they're not feeling it, but I felt unappreciated, especially being that I was a regular here. She seemed very kind with everyone else but in a way, ignored me.

Again, the food was great but the service left a horrible taste in my mouth.

Don't see myself walking back in here.
Very nice server. The turkey sausages seemed old but the eggs and hash browns were tasty.

Stopped here for lunch while visiting the university.  My daughter had poached eggs and fruit, my wife had pumpkin nut bread bread french toast and I had one of the best gyros ever!  In fact, everyone was very happy with their meal and service was excellent!  We did eat inside but didn't stress as the owners have done a nice job keeping customers safe.

You need all of your party present to put your name down which is quite annoying but I understand. The food was so good and cheaper than expected. They have a qr code menu which is nice. They didn't split our bill or ask if it needed to be split which was a little hassle between our group.
Love the decor and the staff was very friendly!

Nice location and ambiance but slow service and poor food quality. QR code online menu hides prices. Attached is a photo showing a bug found in our food (questionable kitchen cleanliness), no compensation was provided, the item was just remade. Many better options in Ann Arbor especially considering the cost

aMa Bistro was a very nice restaurant especially in a college town! We had the vegetable omelet, stuffed french toast, and the furghessa which were all very nice. I think the stuffed french toast is as must try but everything was great over all. Have a try!

The decor is cute and the Albanian khima was pretty good, although I think the baked furghessa would have been an even better choice looking at what my friend's ordered. Did seem to take a long time to get the food, but still worth a visit (assuming you're not in a rush of course).

update: even at 8:30 a.m. while the restaurant was empty, with a party of 15, they wouldn’t seat us unless all 15 were there.

don’t visit on a weekend unless your entire party is willing to wait 30+ minutes. even when 3/4 people in our party were there, we were skipped over when tables were ready. An extra fifth person joined our party while we were waiting, and the host was so unfriendly and cold that I was wondering if she would make our party leave after already having seated us. i was charged for a side when my order’s description said it included a side and wasn’t told this until it showed up on the bill. food was bland but the servers were friendly and the food was plated well. spare yourself the wait and overpriced food and go to franks instead
